derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from Old French cisoires, from late Latin cisoria, plural of cisorium 'cutting instrument', from cis-, variant of caes-, stem of caedere 'to cut'. The spelling with sc- (16th cent.) was by association with the Latin stem sciss- 'cut'

entry.def: Scissors are a small cutting tool with two sharp blades that are screwed together. You use scissors for cutting things such as paper and cloth.

example.ex: He told me to get some scissors...
She picked up a pair of scissors from the windowsill.
example.tran: 她从窗台上拿起一把剪刀。

means.word_mean: 1. and edge tool having two crossed pivoting blades
2. a wrestling hold in which you wrap your legs around the opponents body or head and put your feet together and squeeze
3. a gymnastic exercise performed on the pommel horse when the gymnast moves his legs as scissors move
